## Description {#details}

A simple intrusive list implementation.

This is a simple intrusive list for a <code>T</code> that inherits from <code><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/ilist-node">ilist&#95;node&lt;T&gt;</a></code>. The list never takes ownership of anything inserted in it.

Unlike <em><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/iplist">iplist&lt;T&gt;</a></em> and <em><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a62ea5abc9af8e7ee394912e2617cf30f">ilist&lt;T&gt;</a></em>, <em>simple&#95;ilist&lt;T&gt;</em> never deletes values, and has no callback traits.

The API for adding nodes include <em><a href="#a6941eb16363576156b03219aea264b91">push&#95;front()</a></em>, <em><a href="#acd9e9e84ef0b4b94fdda7d6ceff1e01d">push&#95;back()</a></em>, and <em><a href="#a7f4bd492b552181942252ccddc0db26e">insert()</a></em>. These all take values by reference (not by pointer), except for the range version of <em><a href="#a7f4bd492b552181942252ccddc0db26e">insert()</a></em>.

There are three sets of API for discarding nodes from the list: <em><a href="#af373b4ab7e8cd5a179d3c86ee3404912">remove()</a></em>, which takes a reference to the node to remove, <em><a href="#a4b588a868b58f1ac0917a59e7c48b5cc">erase()</a></em>, which takes an iterator or iterator range and returns the next one, and <em><a href="#a9e8f24dd616634c0f94649826a6c534f">clear()</a></em>, which empties out the container. All three are constant time operations. None of these deletes any nodes; in particular, if there is a single node in the list, then these have identical semantics: 
<ul>
<li><code>L.remove</code>(L.front());</li>
<li><code>L.erase</code>(L.begin());</li>
<li><code>L.clear()</code>;</li>
</ul>
As a convenience for callers, there are parallel APIs that take a <code>Disposer</code> (such as <code>std::default&#95;delete&lt;T&gt;</code>): <em><a href="#afb5871f1692d8db06f33611f9bdddb85">removeAndDispose()</a></em>, <em><a href="#a07d0b4e0e3d2ef200f612297e7d63b9d">eraseAndDispose()</a></em>, and <em><a href="#af3e13ba39a57af4a57b5e7d0cc553f0e">clearAndDispose()</a></em>. These have different names because the extra semantic is otherwise non-obvious. They are equivalent to calling <em>std::for&#95;each()</em> on the range to be discarded.

The currently available <code>Options</code> customize the nodes in the list. The same options must be specified in the <em><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/ilist-node">ilist&#95;node</a></em> instantiation for compatibility (although the order is irrelevant). 
<ul>
<li><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/use">Use</a> <em><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/ilist-tag">ilist&#95;tag</a></em> to designate which <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/ilist-node">ilist&#95;node</a> for a given <code>T</code> this list should use. This is useful if a type <code>T</code> is part of multiple, independent lists simultaneously.</li>
<li><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/use">Use</a> <em><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/ilist-sentinel-tracking">ilist&#95;sentinel&#95;tracking</a></em> to always (or never) track whether a node is a sentinel. Specifying <code>true</code> enables the <em><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/ilist-node-impl/#a0570092282570244c4d7af86003f0aa9">ilist&#95;node::isSentinel()</a></em> API. Unlike <em>ilist&#95;node::isKnownSentinel()</em>, which is only appropriate for assertions, <em><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/ilist-node-impl/#a0570092282570244c4d7af86003f0aa9">ilist&#95;node::isSentinel()</a></em> is appropriate for real logic.</li>
</ul>
Here are examples of <code>Options</code> usage: 
<ul>
<li><code>simple&#95;ilist&lt;T&gt;</code> gives the defaults.</li>
<li><code><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/simple-ilist">simple&#95;ilist&lt;T,ilist&#95;sentinel&#95;tracking&lt;true&gt;&gt;</a></code> enables the <em><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/ilist-node-impl/#a0570092282570244c4d7af86003f0aa9">ilist&#95;node::isSentinel()</a></em> API.</li>
<li><code><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/simple-ilist">simple&#95;ilist</a>&lt;T</code>,<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/ilist-tag">ilist&#95;tag</a>,<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/ilist-sentinel-tracking">ilist&#95;sentinel&#95;tracking&lt;false&gt;</a>&gt; specifies a tag of A and that tracking should be off (even when LLVM&#95;ENABLE&#95;ABI&#95;BREAKING&#95;CHECKS are enabled).</li>
<li><code><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/simple-ilist">simple&#95;ilist</a>&lt;T</code>,<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/ilist-sentinel-tracking">ilist&#95;sentinel&#95;tracking&lt;false&gt;</a>,<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/ilist-tag">ilist&#95;tag</a>&gt; is equivalent to the last.</li>
</ul>
See <em>is&#95;valid&#95;option</em> for steps on adding a new option.

Definition at line 78 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/simple-ilist-h">simple&#95;ilist.h</a>.
